intro: Euosmus, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their small, showy flowers that often display vibrant colors. Euosmus species typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They have a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and are often found in coastal or inland regions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
